intro: Adenophora latifolia f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered adenophora, is a flowering plant in the Campanulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, white or pale blue flowers. The flowers are typically borne in clustered inflorescences and bloom during the summer months. This plant is native to parts of East Asia, including China and Korea, and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
